SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Income earned on Rensselaer's endowment provides support to students through scholarships, fellowships and prizes. In addition, income is used to provide support to the Institute in the form of professorships, lectures, departmental programs and institutional initiatives.

Effective July 1,2008, Rensselaer adopted the FASB Interpretation No.48 ("FIN48"), Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes-an interpretation of SFAS No.109, Accounting for Income Taxes. The adoption did not have a material effect on the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Institute shall be open to all students who are qualified according to its admission standards, barring no one on the basis of race, color, creed, national origin, age, religion, marital status, veteran status, disability, sex, or sexual orientation. Efforts shall be made to seek out and admit students of diverse socioeconomic backgrounds whose potential could be reached through a Rensselaer education.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Administration, monitoring and oversight of grants is conducted to oversee the progress and completion of the grants , ensuring compliance with all relevant terms and conditions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Part I, Line 1b: Reason for not following policy regarding payment provisions for expenses
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Rensselaer's President is allowed first class travel on Rensselaer business in accordance with the terms of her employment agreement, which was approved by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees. The President's expenses are subject to review by the Board of Trustees, including any amounts for spousal or companion travel. The Board has oversight of strategic issues for facilities management, which includes capital improvements and other costs for the residence for Rensselaer's President. The Board of Rensselaer also oversees the review and audit of expenses of the President relating to the presidential residence and personal services associated with the upkeep of the residence, which review and audit occurs under the Board's oversight on an at least annual basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 7: Non-Fixed payments not listed above
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Rensselaer maintains a performance incentive program in connection with the annual evaluation process for its President and Executive Officers. Eligibility for receipt of such incentive payments is limited to certain Executive Officers. Performance awards are made subject to review by the Compensation Committee of the Board based upon such annual evaluations, with the amount of such awards, if any, at its discretion.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: City of Troy Capital Resource Corporation

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Rensselaer County Industrial Development Agency:The date of rebate computation - December, 2007.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: AUXILIARYNumber of housing units available: Dorm rooms 2,761 Single apts 850 Number of students on meal plans: 3,032 OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: Other Program Services include activities that further Rensselaer's exempt purpose.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is provided to the Board of Trustees prior to filing via a secure website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Rensselaer's Trustees, Institute leaders, faculty, and selected staff involved in purchasing, finance and budgeting functions are required annually to review Rensselaer's Conflict of Interest and Commitment Policy and affirmatively verify they are free of any conflict of interest or commitment. Potential conflicts of interest and/or commitments are reviewed by an Institute-wide committee. Also, a report is made to the Board of Trustees Audit Committee annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Rensselaer Board of Trustees has delegated the compensation of the President of Rensselaer to the Compensation and Personnel Development Committee of the Board. The Compensation Committee retains an independent compensation consultant to provide a Compensation and Benefits report to determine the compensation of the President of Rensselaer. The President of Rensselaer holds a non-voting seat on the Board of Trustees and does not participate or attend any discussions or communications by the Board or its designated committee which are held in consideration of her own compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Conflict of Interest policy is available via Rensselaer's website. The disclosure of governing documents and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.
